activities: ePals and ePals' controlled US subsidiaries uses personal information that it receives from the EU primarily for (1) customer support activities, such as fulfilling product orders, providing technical support and improving product offerings; (2) sales and marketing activities as permissible under applicable law; (3) enabling and providing product services online, such as software as a service offerings and business optimization services; and (4) internal business processes such as financial processing and management, fraud detection and prevention, and compliance with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies.
